title: Cilbir (Turkish Poached Eggs)

ingredients.name: Aleppo pepper or red pepper flakes

steps: Combine room-temperature yogurt, minced garlic, and kosher salt in a bowl. Whisk well.
Divide yogurt mixture between two serving bowls and set aside.
Bring a medium saucepan of water to a boil and stir in vinegar.
Crack an egg into a fine mesh sieve over a bowl. Gently swirl to drain excess egg white. Transfer to a ramekin.
Create a vortex in boiling water using a wooden spoon. Add egg to center and cook 2-3 minutes.
Remove egg with slotted spoon to parchment-lined plate.
While second egg cooks, warm olive oil and Aleppo pepper in a small skillet over medium heat.
Place poached eggs on yogurt mixture.
notes: Volume conversions: 1 cup yogurt ≈ 245g, 1-2 garlic cloves ≈ 6g, 3 tbsp olive oil ≈ 42g, 1-2 tbsp vinegar ≈ 15g, 2 tsp Aleppo pepper ≈ 6g
Yogurt should be at room temperature for best results
Serve with crusty bread for dipping
